accessibilityDescription: Special Assistance for Members of the Public:  City staff can arrange for special assistance with some advance notice. If you need special assistance, please call 416-392-7033, TTY 416-338-0889 or e-mail teycc@toronto.ca.

addressList.fullAddress: Blue jays Way & Spadina Avenue Toronto Ontario

backgroundInformationList.description: Renaming a portion of "Blue Jays Way" between Spadina Avenue and Navy Wharf Court - “CityPlace Way"

contact.contactName: Toronto and East York Community Council

decisionBody: Toronto and East York Community Council
noticeDescription:
To consider a proposal to rename a portion of the existing public highway "Blue Jays Way" between Spadina Avenue and Navy Wharf Court as “CityPlace Way".

The plan showing the lands to be affected may be seen in the City Clerk's Office, Secretariat, 2nd Floor, West Tower, Toronto City Hall, 100 Queen Street West, between the hours of 8:30 a.m. and 4:30 p.m. Monday to Friday. At its meeting to be held in Committee Room 1, 2nd floor, Toronto City Hall, 100 Queen Street West, on February 5, 2020 at 9:30 a.m., or shortly afterwards, the Toronto and East York Community Council will hear in person or by his or her counsel, agent or solicitor, any person who claims that his or her lands will be prejudicially affected by the naming and who applies to be heard with respect to the proposed naming.

Notice to People writing or making presentations to the Toronto and East York Community Council:  The personal information contained in your correspondence to Toronto City Council or its committees is collected under the City of Toronto Act, 2006, and the City of Toronto Municipal Code Chapter 27 – Council Procedures, section 27-21. Any personal information will become part of the public record and may be posted on the City's website, unless you expressly request the removal of personal identity information. Questions about the collection of this information may be directed to the City Clerk's office at 416-392-7033.

The City videotapes committee and community council meetings. If you make a presentation to a committee or community council, the City will be videotaping you and City staff may make the video tapes available to the public.

To obtain additional information, submit comments or address the Toronto and East York Community Council meeting on February 5, 2020, please contact the following City official no later than 4:30 p.m. on February 4, 2020.

Ms. Ellen Devlin

Administrator, Toronto and East York Community Council

City Clerk’s Office

Toronto City Hall, 100 Queen Street West

2nd floor, West Tower

Toronto, Ontario M5H 2N2

Telephone: 416-392-7033; Fax: 416-397-0111

E-mail: teycc@toronto.ca

otherReferenceList.description: 2020.TE13.1 - Renaming of a portion of Blue Jays Way between Spadina Avenue and Navy Wharf Court

subheading: Notice is given that the City of Toronto will consider whether to pass a by-law to authorize the Renaming of a portion of the existing public highway in the Toronto and East York Community Council Area
title: Renaming a portion of the existing public highway "Blue Jays Way" between Spadina Avenue and Navy Wharf Court as “CityPlace Way"
topics: Transportation > Intention to name a road or highway
